meanings.definition: The existence of two or more stereoisomers of a compound that are not mirror images of each other.
meanings.sent1: Diastereoisomerism can occur when molecules have different arrangements of atoms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study diastereoisomerism to understand how molecules interact in nature.
meanings.sent3: At the chemistry party, diastereoisomerism and its friends danced in unique patterns.
meanings.sent4: The concept of diastereoisomerism sheds light on the diversity of molecular structures.
meanings.sent5: In the world of molecules, diastereoisomerism adds a colorful twist to chemical reactions.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which two or more stereoisomers of a compound have different physical and chemical properties.
meanings.sent1: Diastereoisomerism can lead to variations in how substances behave in experiments.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use diastereoisomerism to distinguish between different forms of a molecule.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit about diastereoisomerism had the audience laughing at the unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent4: In the laboratory, diastereoisomerism acts like a disguise, fooling researchers with its different properties.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained diastereoisomerism with vivid examples of chemical transformations.
